
**Reactants:** CO and O~2~

**Basis:** $\dot V_{CO,in}$ = 1 L s^-1^.

**Given Relationships**

$$
\dot V_{\text{air},in}$ = \dot V_{CO,in}
$$

Air is 21% O~2~.

**Limiting Reactant Criterion**

$$
\frac{\dot n_{i,in}}{\left| \nu_i \right|}\Bigg\rvert_{\substack{ i\text{ = limiting} \\ \text{reactant}}} < \frac{\dot n_{k,in}}{\left| \nu_k \right|}\Bigg\rvert_{\substack{ \text{all } k \, \neq  \text{ limiting} \\ \text{reactant}}} \tag{1}
$$

$$
\frac{P\dot V_{i,in}}{RT\left| \nu_i \right|}\Bigg\rvert_{\substack{ i\text{ = limiting} \\ \text{reactant}}} < \frac{P\dot V_{k,in}}{RT\left| \nu_k \right|}\Bigg\rvert_{\substack{ \text{all } k \, \neq  \text{ limiting} \\ \text{reactant}}}
$$

$$
\frac{\dot V_{i,in}}{\left| \nu_i \right|}\Bigg\rvert_{\substack{ i\text{ = limiting} \\ \text{reactant}}} < \frac{\dot V_{k,in}}{\left| \nu_k \right|}\Bigg\rvert_{\substack{ \text{all } k \, \neq  \text{ limiting} \\ \text{reactant}}} \tag{2}
$$

$$
\dot V_{O_2,in} = 0.21 \dot V_{\text{air},in} = 0.21 \text{ L s}^{-1} \tag{3}
$$

$$
\frac{\dot V_{CO,in}}{\left| \nu_{CO} \right|} = \frac{1 \text{ L s}^{-1}}{\left|-2\right|} = 0.5 \text{ L s}^{-1} \tag{4}
$$

$$
\frac{\dot V_{O_2,in}}{\left| \nu_{O_2} \right|} = \frac{0.21 \text{ L s}^{-1}}{\left|-1\right|} = 0.21 \text{ L s}^{-1} \tag{5}
$$

The stoichiometric equivalence of O~2~ is smaller than that of CO, so **O~2~ is the limiting reactant**.
